subject: p13135946
History: Evaluation of the patient after mitral valve replacement and CABG.
Findings: Portable AP radiograph of the chest was reviewed in comparison to prior study obtained the same day earlier. The ET tube tip is 5 cm above the carina. The right subclavian line tip is at the level of cavoatrial junction. The Dobbhoff tube tip is in the stomach. Heart size and mediastinum are stable. There is substantial interval improvement of pulmonary edema. Left lower lobe opacity and bilateral pleural effusions are noted.
